intro: Aspidistra extrorsa, commonly known as the Chinese evergreen, is a perennial evergreen plant native to southeastern China. It belongs to the family Araceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green, strap-shaped leaves that grow in a dense rosette. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or white, followed by dark blue berries. It is well adapted to low-light conditions and is popular as a houseplant due to its hardiness and ornamental value. Aspidistra extrorsa thrives in humid environments and requires moderate watering to maintain its lush foliage.
